channel.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
channel.description: when i keep the server's the ip to 0.0.0.0 then compile and open my server i can log in... but when i want to change it to my ip I can't log in neither can anyone esle... I went to CanYouSeeMe.Org and it says my ports open... But i can't log in What do you guys think is wronge ?!?! [IMG]http://i1181.photobucket.com/albums/x424/Yasin_Sheikh/Porton.jpg[/img]

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

[quote=“Scaar, post:12, topic:384781”]^^ youre a moron?

lawl anywho did you port forward coirrectly?

did you add the no-ip to your firewall exceptions?[/quote]
You are a moron. He already clearly stated others can connect to his computer.

@op: in your cmd, type “ipconfig”. Your brother should try connecting to your server using the IPv4 address. Worked for me…

Also, I was able to connect to my own server using no-ip, so no to all the people saying you need to use 0.0.0.0/127.0.0.1/192.xxx.xxx.xxx

Read full topic

Here at moparscape we offer free help, so please do take advantage of this. It is actually against the rules to offer a reward for help so I will have to ask you to remove your offer please. Thank you.

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @_kush †kush†
item.description:
@_kush wrote:

Actually, I have seen server’s request ip’s, some 317s. =.=". I think…

Also, your IP shouldn’t be 0.0.0.0, if you want to connect to yourself, make it 127.0.0.1, if you want other people to connect to you, change it to your no-ip, and compile/build the Client, re-upload, and let people download it again. People should be able to connect to you, cause obviously you’ve portfowarded if the website says it can see your port, and usually I have to turn off all my firewalls to get connection, (AVG block’s connections as well for some reason, the resident shield I believe.) If you’re using a router, also check and make sure that you can receive in-coming connections (traffic) from other computers. Some routers actually have the option to disable In-coming Connections.

After you’re done all that, try using the rl status checker, it works fine for other people. :9. Any more problems just post…

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @belhelmiel belhelmiel
item.description:
@belhelmiel wrote:

Lol. Are the server and the client set to the same port? And the server cant have the ip changed :\ just change the clients ip and make sure the ports match 43594 is what they need to be. It’s that simple if you keep having errors it’s probably your compiler. If you want to test it try changing the title of the game (at the top) not the cmd boxes title the title of the actual game it should be in Jframe if you have pi and i think gui.java for delta. Not sure if thats right or not. Then compile if the new title appears then your compilers fine and if it doesn’t then either your compiler is broke or you didn’t actually change the title. Which you can use z-file search (should be on there) or byte searcher open one of them with java type the EXACT same caps and all title and whatever file it shows up in go in it and change it to your title compile and see if that works. That should guarantee if your compiler works.

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

You would have to make a new run.bat file for windows 7 users and put this in it.

@echo off title Client cd ./Class/ "C:\Program Files (x86)\Java\jre6\bin\java.exe" -Xmx200m Gui 30 0 lowmem members 32 pause This is from my PI client so convert it to whatever server you are using as you never stated before.

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

This is all client sided. Nothing to do with the server unless its on a different port. But to connect from your own computer change the ip to 0.0.0.0 and then to your other players change it to your no-ip. Very simple

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @RiiPiiNFtW RiiPiiNFtW
item.description:
@RiiPiiNFtW wrote:

Don’t change the ip in your server to 0.0.0.0 0.0.0.0 is a IP that allows another program to cover it as No-ip does. Leave your server ip to 0.0.0.0, make sure if you are running the server on your computer and a client than make sure the client you use to log in is on the IP of 0.0.0.0 Any other client will require the ip of your server through no-ip.

Read full topic

item.title: Willing Pay... Plz Help
item.dc:creator: @Scaar1 Scaar
item.description:
@Scaar1 wrote:

Mopar doesnt allow payments for help, But how did you start up your server?

I suggest doing it in this format:

  1. open no-ip
    2.run server
  2. let server load up
  3. Try connecting.

If that doesnt work try changing the Ip for your server Client and server sided

Read full topic
